page.title: 11Television, Murroes
page.content: For most of the area a television signal is provided by the UHF transmitter at Balcalk, a few miles to the north-west. Most viewers tune in to{Grampian {Television,}but a sizeable minority watch BBC-1, and a lesser number BBC-2 or Channel 4. In the higher part of the district a viewable Scottish Television picture is received from Craigkelly near Burntisland in Fife. All TV transmissions are now on UHF and{625}lines, with most families viewing in colour. Until 1984 however a{405_line}VHF transmitter at Douglas- wood provided black and white pictures to the area. Many families now own a {videorecorder}to record programmes for later viewing or to watch prerecorded films on tape.
